prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1103, 0.0] After setting up the coordinate system, create a new sketch for the X-Y plane with the following face and loop: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2206, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.2206, 0.0], End Point [0.2206, 0.0588] - Line 3: Start Point [0.2206, 0.0588], End Point [0.0, 0.0588] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0588], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The sketch is now ready. Extrude the sketch along the normals by 0.0551 units and in the opposite direction of the normals by 0.0551 units. Scale the sketch with a scaling factor of 0.2206 and set the operation as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation'. The dimensions of the part are 0.2206 units in length, 0.1103 units in width, and 0.2206 units in height. Part 2 Next, create a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom to connect to the previous prism. Use the same coordinate system as Part 1. Create a new sketch for the X-Y plane and add the following faces and loops: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2206, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.2206, 0.0], End Point [0.2206, 0.0588] - Line 3: Start Point [0.2206, 0.0588], End Point [0.0, 0.0588] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0588], End Point [0.0, 0.0] * Face 2 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.2206, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.2206, 0.0588] - Line 3: Start Point [0.2206, 0.0588], End Point [0.2206, 0.0] Extrude the sketch along the normals by 0.0331 units and in the opposite direction of the normals by 0.0331 units. Scale the sketch with a scaling factor of 0.75 and set the operation as 'JoinFeatureOperation'. The dimensions of this part are 0.75 units in length, 0.0662 units in width, and 0.75 units in height. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, with both parts connected.</description>
